channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Generation Grit: Once suicidal after accident leaves him paralysed, he finds hope in art
item.description:
June 02, 2020 7:52 PM

SINGAPORE - The last thing Mr Victor Hoon remembers of his accident in 2005 is speeding up on his motorcycle around a bend while on his way to a friend's home.

item.title: Youth pleads guilty to abusing maid and telling her she 'had no right to be in Singapore'
item.description:
June 02, 2020 7:07 PM

SINGAPORE - A youth not only spat on his family's domestic helper and threw a metal mug at her face which left her with injuries, but also told her that she was "only a maid, was poor and had no right to be in Singapore."

item.title: Evening Update: Today's headlines from The Straits Times on June 2
item.description:
June 02, 2020 6:30 PM

Good evening! Catch up on some of the main headlines on Tuesday, June 2.

item.title: Coronavirus: Jail, fine for woman who cheated 23 people after saying she had masks for sale on Carousell
item.description:
June 02, 2020 5:59 PM

SINGAPORE - A radiologist cheated 23 people of nearly $1,500 after duping them into believing that she had face masks to sell amid the coronavirus outbreak.

item.title: Man, 21, pleads guilty to committing loan-shark harassment during circuit breaker period
item.description:
June 02, 2020 5:25 PM

SINGAPORE - A full-time national serviceman (NSF) who left his home to commit loan-shark harassment during the circuit breaker period pleaded guilty to breaching safe distancing measures on Tuesday (June 2).

item.title: Premier has lowest taxi rental rate after operators cut rebates
item.description:
June 02, 2020 4:42 PM

SINGAPORE - All taxi operators have followed ComfortDelGro's lead in reducing rental rebates, although rental rates vary widely across companies.

item.title: End of the road for car-sharing firm Smove
item.description:
June 02, 2020 4:28 PM

SINGAPORE - Car-sharing firm Smove is under liquidation - the first major player in the vehicle rental market to go bust in recent years.

item.title: Car rentals reeling from Covid-19 fallout
item.description:
June 02, 2020 4:25 PM

SINGAPORE - Fuelled by private-hire demand, Singapore's rental car population had been growing exponentially since 2014. But the coronavirus put the brakes on that trend.

item.title: 1.5 million packets of counterfeit cigarettes seized, three arrested
item.description:
June 02, 2020 3:54 PM

SINGAPORE - Three men were arrested in simultaneous raids on at least eight locations for their suspected involvement in the import of 1.5 million packets of counterfeit cigarettes with a street value of over $1.1 million.

item.title: TOC contributor loses third bid to mount constitutional challenge in criminal defamation case
item.description:
June 02, 2020 3:27 PM

SINGAPORE - A man accused of defaming members of the Cabinet in an article published on socio-political website The Online Citizen (TOC) has lost his latest bid to mount a constitutional challenge against his criminal charges.

item.title: 544 new coronavirus cases, including 4 community cases
item.description:
June 02, 2020 3:11 PM

Three community cases are work pass holders, the fourth is a Singaporean or permanent resident.

item.title: Coronavirus: Passengers to be banned from front seat of Grab car; have to declare health and hygiene status
item.description:
June 02, 2020 2:16 PM

Drivers and passengers will both be able to cancel rides if the other party appears to be unwell or is not wearing a mask.

item.title: Roads and trains get more crowded as people return to school and work after circuit breaker
item.description:
June 02, 2020 2:09 PM

The first day after the end of the circuit breaker, however, came nowhere close to seeing the rush-hour crowd of the days before the Covid-19 outbreak.

item.title: Probation for student who took upskirt videos even at his own school
item.description:
June 02, 2020 1:48 PM

SINGAPORE - A Republic Polytechnic (RP) student who recorded upskirt videos of multiple women at different places including his own school was sentenced on Tuesday (June 2) to 18 months' probation.

item.title: Coronavirus: Safe distancing concerns over crowds at Lucky Plaza
item.description:
June 02, 2020 1:00 PM

SINGAPORE (THE NEW PAPER) - To send money to her family in the Philippines, Ms Em Jei Valdez, a foreign domestic worker (FDW) here for 13 years, had been using Singtel Dash since 2018.

item.title: ComfortDelGro taxi drivers to deliver essential medical supplies to patients' homes
item.description:
June 02, 2020 12:56 PM

SINGAPORE - Public healthcare institutions can now tap ComfortDelGro taxi drivers to deliver medicine to patients with pre-existing conditions who require regular top-ups.

item.title: Road Safety Month begins as Singapore reopens
item.description:
June 02, 2020 11:20 AM

SINGAPORE - The eighth Singapore Road Safety Month was launched on Tuesday (June 2), with traffic expected to increase as Singapore enters the first day of its post-circuit breaker reopening.

item.title: 7 charged with offences under Covid-19 regulations in Robertson Quay incident
item.description:
June 02, 2020 10:59 AM

Court documents didÂ not state whether the seven alleged offenders were employment pass holders.

item.title: Schools reopen with tight safety measures in place, prolonged closure would have tremendous impact on kids: Ong Ye Kung
item.description:
June 02, 2020 10:53 AM

He added that education is not just about taking exams and getting good grades but also about character and socio-emotional development.

item.title: Phased reopening will protect lives and livelihoods; S'poreans must get used to new normal: Lawrence Wong
item.description:
June 02, 2020 8:45 AM

SINGAPORE - A phased approach to reopening Singapore will help protect both lives and livelihoods, but Singaporeans must get used to the "new normal" of living with restrictions, said National Development Minister Lawrence Wong.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on June 2
ComfortDelGro cabbies to pay 50% rental rates from today
item.description:
June 02, 2020 5:00 AM

The full rental waiver for ComfortDelGro cabbies ended yesterday.

item.title: Essential projects restart but most construction work to resume gradually
item.description:
June 02, 2020 5:00 AM

After an eight-week break, workers from a few essential infrastructure projects led by building solutions group ISOTeam will be returning to their work sites today.

item.title: More caught for meeting others from different households
item.description:
June 02, 2020 5:00 AM

While most Singaporeans have been adhering to safe distancing measures and wearing masks outside their homes, more people have been caught meeting others outside their households, Minister for the Environment and Water Resources Masagos Zulkifli said yesterday.

item.title: More virtual tours of HDB heartland spaces in the works
item.description:
June 02, 2020 5:00 AM

Going online to check out the hidden gems in some HDB towns is a big hit, so much so that the Housing Board has taken steps to let people go on a virtual visit of every town to uncover each one's pride and joy.

item.title: Trains, buses return to pre-circuit breaker frequency from today
item.description:
June 02, 2020 5:00 AM

Commuters can expect regular train and bus services as the nation gears up to return to work today, when circuit breaker measures are eased.

item.title: Regional 'travel bubbles' likely in time, says Lawrence Wong
item.description:
June 02, 2020 5:00 AM

Discussions on special lanes to restart travel within Asean or even a broader bloc within Asia should take place in time to come, Minister for National Development Law-rence Wong said yesterday.

item.title: Lawyer loses defamation suits against condo MC member
item.description:
June 02, 2020 5:00 AM

A lawyer failed in a defamation suit against a housewife after a judge found her justified in taking issue over his competence as the secretary of a condominium management council (MC).

item.title: New standards to be piloted at upcoming Quick Build Dorms
item.description:
June 02, 2020 5:00 AM

New standards will be established for upcoming migrant worker dormitories, including lowering the number of residents per room and the number of people who must share toilets and sick bays.

item.title: Job applications open for 1,000 digital ambassadors
item.description:
June 02, 2020 5:00 AM

The 1,000 digital ambassadors that will be hired this month to help stallholders and seniors learn digital skills will be paid between $1,800 and $2,100 a month, according to multiple job listings for the role seen by The Straits Times.

item.title: HSA flags 'S'pore-based medical device firm' over scam concerns
item.description:
June 02, 2020 5:00 AM

A medical equipment company claiming to be based in Singapore has been brought to the authorities' attention here as its claims appear to be part of a scam.

item.title: Face shields cannot be worn in place of masks
item.description:
June 02, 2020 5:00 AM

People will have to wear face masks instead of face shields when they leave home, following a review of an earlier policy in which either option had been allowed.

item.title: Infrastructure remains bright spot for business, employment
item.description:
June 02, 2020 5:00 AM

Amid gloomy economic forecasts triggered by the Covid-19 pandemic, infrastructure remains a bright spot that can increase business activity and employment, said Minister in the Prime Minister's Office and Second Minister for Finance Indranee Rajah.

item.title: Covid-19 offenders penalised regardless of nationality: MOM
item.description:
June 02, 2020 5:00 AM

More than 100 Employment Pass (EP) holders had their work passes revoked in the last three years after being convicted of criminal offences or for making false declarations in work pass applications.

item.title: Which workers can leave dorms for work? Find out with new app
item.description:
June 02, 2020 5:00 AM

A new app, SGWorkPass, will show which migrant workers can leave their dormitories for work.

item.title: Serial lingerie thief found unsuitable for treatment order
item.description:
June 02, 2020 5:00 AM

A serial lingerie thief has been found to be unsuitable for a mandatory treatment order (MTO), a district court heard yesterday. This means he may end up behind bars.

item.title: Transfers of migrant workers to other employers allowed
item.description:
June 02, 2020 5:00 AM

Migrant workers could be transferred to another employer via a system to help preserve their jobs, if their company can no longer keep them on due to the economic fallout from Covid-19.

item.title: Shops, market stalls in PAP-run estates to get 15% S&CC rebate
item.description:
June 02, 2020 5:00 AM

Some 26,000 shops as well as market and food stalls in estates managed by the People's Action Party (PAP) will get a service and conservancy charge (S&CC) rebate of 15 per cent from July to October.

item.title: Foreign workers still needed in construction: Wong
item.description:
June 02, 2020 5:00 AM

While Singapore will continue to push for fewer foreign workers, it is not realistic to do without them entirely in the construction industry, National Development Minister Lawrence Wong said yesterday, as he unveiled plans for new dormitories for workers.

item.title: All pump prices down after SPC's resistance
item.description:
June 02, 2020 5:00 AM

All pump operators here have adjusted their prices downwards since Esso and Shell reduced rates by around three cents last Friday.

item.title: Plans to overhaul housing for foreign workers unveiled
item.description:
June 02, 2020 5:00 AM

Some 60,000 short-term bed spaces will be created to house foreign workers here by the end of this year in the first step towards a major overhaul of dormitories announced yesterday.

item.title: Former JCs among 36 sites to be used for housing migrant workers
item.description:
June 02, 2020 5:00 AM

Thirty-six unused state properties, including former schools, will be converted into temporary accommodation for migrant workers by the end of this year.

item.title: Hostel or hotel stay for homeless during circuit breaker
item.description:
June 02, 2020 5:00 AM

They spend their nights sleeping rough in the open and sometimes, on park benches and at void decks.

item.title: Stay vigilant, PM Lee urges as circuit breaker period ends
item.description:
June 02, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore has to remain cautious and vigilant after exiting the circuit breaker, as dealing with the coronavirus pandemic is "a marathon, not a sprint", Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong said yesterday.

item.title: 51-year-old is youngest to die from virus; no new cases in community
item.description:
June 02, 2020 5:00 AM

A 51-year-old man from China, who had been working in Singapore for almost 20 years, died on Sunday from complications owing to Covid-19.

item.title: Further renovation delays as firms await BCA nod
item.description:
June 02, 2020 5:00 AM

For the past two months, Ms Nura Rashid and her family of five have been living in a half-renovated four-room HDB flat in Woodlands without a kitchen and master bedroom toilet.

item.title: Some workers, students all set to return to offices and schools
item.description:
June 02, 2020 5:00 AM

Besides the usual textbooks and stationery, Mr Melvyn Goh has packed a few more items in his daughter's school bag - an extra face mask and an antibacterial facial spray.

item.title: No certainty curbs will be eased enough for F1 race
item.description:
June 02, 2020 5:00 AM

It is "very uncertain" whether Covid-19 restrictions will be eased enough by September such that crowds can gather to watch the Formula One night race in Singapore, said National Development Minister Lawrence Wong.

item.title: SPH Foundation donates $300k to help vulnerable groups
item.description:
June 02, 2020 5:00 AM

The Singapore Press Holdings (SPH) Foundation is donating $300,000 to the Community Chest to support seniors, disadvantaged families and the disabled, among others, as the coronavirus crisis enters its fifth month since the first case was reported here on Jan 23.

item.title: Muslim couples may solemnise marriage in person from today
item.description:
June 02, 2020 5:00 AM

Muslim couples can choose to make their marriage vows in person from today, although the number of attendees will be capped at 10 and solemnisations through video links are still encouraged.

item.title: Care packs to thank those in front line of Covid-19 fight
item.description:
June 02, 2020 5:00 AM

More than 20,000 people defending Singapore against Covid-19 have received additional armour in the form of hand sanitisers, face masks and wet wipes - thanks to an initiative by the Home Team Volunteer Network.
